newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan Macronix says no US patent infringement.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan Macronix says no US patent infringement.

text.p: Macronix International Corp, a top Taiwan semiconductor maker, said on Tuesday it had never infringed on a patent as alleged in a complaint filed by Atmel Corp with the U.S. International Trade Commission.

"The complaint alleges infringement by Macronix of a single 13-year-old patent owned or controlled by Atmel relating to encoding identifying information, such as who is the manufacturer on a computer chip," Macronix said in a statement.
"Macronix is confident it has never infringed on any of the claims of this patent and intends to vigorously contest the unwarranted allegations of patent infringement alleged by Atmel."
Macronix said it has complied fully with the applicable industry standard to a silicon signature for identifying information on a chip.
"Macronix is prepared to fully cooperate with the current ITC investigation. It also expects to prevail in any action by Atmel against the company," the statement said.
Macronix listed American Depositary Receipts in New York's NASDAQ exchange York in May 1996.
The statement said the company is now the world's seventh largest maker of non-volatile memory chips, including flash memory, EPROM and mask ROM.
